div.p: We are looking for an energetic Java engineer to develop the deployment and application management automation system used by various teams at Apple including the iTunes Store, iCloud, and Maps.

ul.li: Ideally 5+ years of application development experience
Demonstrable experience with J2EE technologies for Web Tier and Business Logic Tier
Should be comfortable working with Object Oriented programming techniques
Hands-on experience with Application/Web Servers such as Tomcat, JBoss, or Glassfish
Familiarity with JDBC, Java serialization APIâ€™s and JMS preferred
Familiarity with JavaScript and AJAX preferred
Comfortable working in Unix environments such as MacOS, Linux etc

div.p:
We are looking for an energetic Java engineer to develop the data center management tool used by various teams at Apple including the iTunes Store, iCloud, and Maps. Work involves adding new features and new development to existing tools.
Job Responsibilities: - Analyze, design, code, inspect, debug, and test new software solutions in the internal tools area with emphasis on Java/J2EE development. - Maintain and enhance existing applications in response to new feature requests - Assist in resolving customer problems - Collaborate closely with members of other teams throughout the release cycle - Occasional after hours support and troubleshooting
BS or higher in a technical field (Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent work experience.

- Competency and motivation to tackle complex problems in a fast-paced environment without compromising the quality of the work - Ability to multi-task and manage tasks with varying priorities - Excellent verbal and written communication skills and high attention to detail - Prior experience designing tools around build system concepts a plus
